utterance.speaker: Note
utterance.content: Throughout this episode, House is wearing his shirts tucked into his pants, and a bracelet on his right wrist.

utterance.speaker: Guard
utterance.content: Get up, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Must be some mistake. I specifically requested my wakeup startle three hours from now.

utterance.speaker: Guard
utterance.content: Some VIP visitor. Dean of Medicine from your old hospital.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I've had dreams about this. I'm going to assume this is another one.

utterance.speaker: Guard
utterance.content: Get up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can refuse to see any visitor I want. Tell the Dean that I don't want to see her.

utterance.speaker: Guard
utterance.content: He said you'd say that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's the hiring policy over there? All ass based?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I can get you out of here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not unless that file has a file in it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Judge's order for your immediate release.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I had eight months added to my sentence two months ago. The math is pretty basic.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We have a crisis. Which, is good news for you. You're out tonight on conditional parole. The condition being that you're employed by me, at PPTH.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, thanks. You think it's a good idea for me to go right back to my old life? For either of us?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Your patient, is two lungs, in a box.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And it only has 12 hours left. No pulse, no body. No ability to answer questions. It's your perfect patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I did pay for the room for the whole week, but…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Donor's an 18-year-old college kid back from Hofstra. Goes to a homecoming party with his buddies, hops on his motorcycle, ends up an organ donor. Asystole in the E.R. No pulse. No blood circulating. His heart, liver, kidneys were all toast. Surgeons had the recipient on the table when they realized the lungs had increased airway resistance. The team closed her up, put the lungs in suspended animation. Buys 24 hours to fix it, 12 of which have passed. We still have no clue what's wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice painting. Blues and greens. Calming, but with a hint of nurturing. Totally offsets the stench of suffering and death. Where's my patient? We need to not talk.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: ICU isolation room. The transplant team will meet you there with updates from the past two hours.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great. Take this.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How about you drop it in your office?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I completely understand and, almost respect your desire to appear to be Dean of Medicine, given that your title is Dean of Medicine. On the other hand… Seriously?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Get this straight. You break the law, you go back to jail. Scam extra Vicodin, back to jail. Flout my authority, make the hospital look bad, back to jail. I own you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, massa.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: See, that, would be an example.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When did Cuddy leave?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She gave her notice the day after your incident. Took a job—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't need the details.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Ortho needed more space. You're this way.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where's my stuff?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No idea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What about my team?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Pathetic. The first thing you said to me was you don't want your old environment. The fourth thing you said was, "where's my old environment?" It's been a year, Taub, Chase, Thirteen all moved on. The world does that sometimes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, it doesn't.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Here's your new office. And there's your new team.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not interested in another department's sloppy seconds.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm not sloppy seconds.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 3:00 a.m. If Foreman had called you in from home, you wouldn't have

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Yes, I was on call for neurology.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, if that were true, you'd be working right now and unavailable to help. Which means that you're hanging out in the hospital pretending to work. Which means you're not just a reject, you're a cowardly reject who was trying to hide her rejectedness from someone.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I am not a reject.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then go back to neurology.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I can't. I punched my attending.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Prison! Sorry, I thought I heard everyone else think that. I was in prison, you see. It was a long time ago, but still, you're curious. Never was raped, not raped-raped. Well, raped-raped, but not raped-raped-raped. Well, now that we've got that completely behind us.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is there cake? Any alveolar exudate?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well it's not ARDS. It's the autumn. Its tick borne disease season. Ehrlichiosis causing bronchialitis. You'll appreciate that I left the "idiots" subtextual.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Blood smear was clear, and we "idiots" treated with broad spectrum antibiotics.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cocaine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dead men don't pee. Tox screen tests for metabolites in the urine. Coke never got past the lungs. Also explains the motorcycle crash. Idiots.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great idea. Unless you're wrong. And by you, I mean me. Then this treatment will burn holes in the lungs. I'd call you idiots again, but at this point I'm starting to doubt whether you understand what I mean by the word. Kato, get Black Beauty and meet me out front. We're gonna find the dead kid's stash.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Since an 18-year-old with organ donor on his license is not a cancer patient, I'm figuring the recipient is a lifetime member of the Wilson cares too much club.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Excellent deduction.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're the reason I'm out of the big house. Doesn't quite make up for never visiting—

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Springing you was Foreman's idea. I wasn't convinced until Simpson failed three times.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It amounts to the same thing. You wanted me back.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: See, I knew you'd over-interpret it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Strong, emotional reaction. I guess that's what a lifetime membership gets you. How’s your wrist?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Healed, thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was wrong. I went to prison. I paid the price.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're a changed man.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I said I was wrong. I didn't say I changed. I haven't. Neither have you—

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Analyze it however you like. We’re not friends anymore.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What can I do?

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: My chest. Angina's back.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Upping the nitro should knock it back down.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: Sis and I were talking, trying to figure out how many hospital sleepovers we've had.

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: It definitely started with the great mastectomy of 2001. God, I miss my boobs. They were spectacular.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: Is there a chance of locating another donor?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's unlikely. Especially since, with the extent of the emphysema, she needs a double lung.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: Better already. It's a good thing that worked. I was gonna make you bring me a bottle. Oh, lighten up, Sis. You know, the least you could do is laugh at a dying lady's jokes.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: Your drinking wasn't funny then, and it's not funny now. Because, you're not dying.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The hospital brought in a consultant to work on the lungs.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: Do you know him? Is he — is he good?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He is an excellent doctor.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We probably shouldn't be turning up unannounced like this. Their son just died.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bright side — they're probably up weeping. Hey, we both assaulted our bosses. It's like we're twins.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I’d really rather not….

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, I'll go first. My boss dumped me. And yours what? Called you his China doll? Joked about what a crappy deal you got for Manhattan? Assumed you have a huge penis? I have no idea what flavor you are, so I thought I’d just cover the spread.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: My mom's Filipino, Dad's Korean, and my boss grabbed my behind.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Behind what? Oh, yeah, your — grabbed your tushy. So now you're pretending to be on call so that your overly protective boyfriend won't find out that you got groped.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I don't have a boyfriend. It's my parents. If they found out what I've done, they'd be mortified.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your parents know your call schedule?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I live with them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. No issues there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Druggies are not known for their honesty. Trust me on this one.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Mr. Weathers, I am sure you're right, but we need to be thorough. Did your son ever smoke marijuana?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry. But we're on a clock.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I think he's about to throw us out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope. His son is dead. The only way that has any meaning is if we fix the lungs and transplant them. It doesn’t matter how much we piss him off as long as we find something. So go back there, piss him off and find something.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Do you know any of the kids at the party with your son?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I understand that we're in a hurry but maybe he should.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your son isn't wearing glasses in any of these pictures.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because he was having headaches?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Answer the question before answering the door.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re right. He was not doing cocaine. He had a brain tumor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't bother. It's for me. Turns out they monitor these monitors.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Thank you, officer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I thought the bracelet was decorative. My aunt had one just like it. Wait a minute.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're allowed to be at the hospital. You're allowed to go home. That was made clear.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dead kid's house was on the way to my apartment. Assuming I got lost, twice.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Those consultants in my office are only costing the hospital 100 bucks every minute I keep them waiting. Why didn't you just tell me what you were doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I knew you were very busy, being vaguely important.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I might have cleared it with the cops.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, it's the word "might" that bumps me, but I’ll run it by you next time.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Getting you out of jail was not a popular decision with the board. I need you to solve this, and I need you to do it without making me look like I can't control you. For both our sakes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Disciplinary hearing should be fun, and the subsequent lingering black mark on your record.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I’m not worried.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We have to wheel this out to the MRI. We should probably leave the body in the bag.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's a mass in the arm. Analyzing part of this tumor is gonna be quicker than a scan.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, where’s the next job? You worry about what people think of you, and parental secrets. The only way that you don't worry about this hearing is if you don't think there's gonna be one. The only way that happens is you leave Princeton Plainsboro.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I had a video interview with Chicago yesterday. It went well.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My money's on rhabdomyosarcoma. Chicago has a great program, and you're a dumbass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Running away from home is a time-honored tradition, but you're not doing it to flee your parents. You're doing it to protect them. That's an insult to everything teen prostitutes have worked for. Time to grow up and come clean.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You're right. I should just drive my car into their living room and tell them

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: Didn't it turn out that he'd stolen the hot dog cart?

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: No, borrowed. Bobby was very insistent on that point.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Seems like someone's feeling better.

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: No more chest pain.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I haven't heard the name Bobby in a long time. How's he doing these days?

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: I don't know. We're not in touch. And don't even pretend like you're not relieved. You never liked him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Bobby is an incredibly fun, great guy. Just not a great influence.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: I would have gone with "colossal drunk."

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was gonna leave that implied, but, yes, colossal drunk.

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: What? It's good for a couple to share a hobby.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Your catheter bag is empty, despite taking in 200 ccs of fluids. I'm gonna have to dial back the nitro.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: Won't her chest pain come back?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We don't have any choice. The nitro is dropping the blood flow to your kidneys. They're shutting down.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is so our song.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: My patient is running out of time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not worried. My team is confirming the diagnosis as we speak.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I want to be understanding. It's your first day back—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See? I smell empathy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You should remember all the good times. Like when I gave you that necklace that you just dumped n the ocean. What were you thinking?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, I haven't forgotten our friendship. For every good memory, there's a slew of bad ones.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Come in.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Paraneoplastic syndrome's out. The lung donor didn't have cancer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tell that to the tumor that I found in his arm.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: That mass wasn't a tumor. It was coagulated plasma. E.R. pumped him full of it. I.V. leaked into his arm. I even did a complete MRI. No cancer anywhere. We've got nothing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just 'cause it wasn't a tumor doesn't mean it didn't mess with the lungs. They're reacting to something in the plasma.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: But every unit of plasma can have up to 25 contributing donors. We need to track down all of them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Still. It's not as bad as a thousand people going down in a gigantic boat, right? My heart will go on.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No. You can't leave the hospital.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 25 donors contributed to the plasma that the lung donor got. My team cannot track down and interview them all in six hours.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I vouch for you to the cops, you take some parole-violating detour celebrating your freedom, justified, of course, by some absurd theory connecting it to the case.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You asked me to ask you. Was that just so you'd enjoy saying no?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't trust you, House. I can't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually you have to.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not absolutely. Not outside the walls of this hospital.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine, then give me a team I don't have to put in quotation marks.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Use the people already on the case.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Give me Chase, Taub, Thirteen.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We don't have the money to pay them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. It went to interior designers, I understand.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You only have Park because she's on neurology's tab. You are making minimum wage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I am?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Get out of my office, please.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What do you got?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Number three went to a baseball game the day before he donated.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Boredom is not transmissible.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He ate a bag of peanuts, and peanut proteins would be. If our donor had an allergy, it could explain the lungs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Don't start that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Start what? I'm enjoying our conversation. The repartee.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: There was no repartee.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That was repartee.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm not doing this for you. I'm doing it to help my patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's just good to hear your voice.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Goodbye.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's my whiteboard. I need it. And he really doesn't care how the cast comes off.

utterance.speaker: Betty
utterance.content: Dr. Foreman warned us that you'd try something. Told me to call him if you did. I'd like to do that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll take this outside.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Donor six traveled to Thailand around Khorat. Region was endemic with dengue fever.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Alcohol.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’d have to be pretty drunk for it to affect a pool of plasma.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: These guys have got that covered. Acute etoh ingestion could have— hey, paint around them, they’re not hurting anyone]

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who's painting?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: The crew's just starting. Paint fumes didn't cause contamination. But, maybe the old paint did. They scraped off the underpass, probably because it contains… lead.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lead.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Chest pain back?

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: It’s worse this time. Is there any way to take the edge off?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We're still working on the lungs. We should know soon.

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: Soon is good.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How's the chelation going?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Reverend Moon started it about 20 minutes ago. You missed lunch tracking down the plasma donors. Got you a Reuben from the cafeteria.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Thanks. Lead exposure's a nice diagnosis. I hope it pays off.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It will.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I appreciate your confidence, but she's not really—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, no, she could die. But technically it will still pay off. Even if your patient dies, someone will get the lungs.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You really haven't changed. But I've given up red meat.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What round of chelation is this?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Fourth. Are you checking up on me, or on House?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: On this case. Unique situation. Oxygenating?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: 98%. Airway resistance down.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Great. Is House okay?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Dad, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: What text?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm consulting on this case. Unique situation.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Lungs are crashing. I have to go. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Increasing to 100% FiO2.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Saline flow is down to 10 ccs.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Blockage? Clot in the line?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Chelation is making it worse. It means we were wrong about lead.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hold the analysis and help me save this thing.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Saline's flushing it forward but getting no return. One-way valve. Vasospasm.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you're right, calcium channel blocker should relax the artery.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: The lungs have no nervous system. Will that still work?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We'll know soon.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Saline flow is rising. Vasospasm’s relaxing. Left lung is pinking up. Good job.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Right middle lobe isn't.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We killed part of the lung.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Page Dr. Pinto stat to the cath lab.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We're going to the cath lab? Are you thinking that maybe—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What? Who? One dead lobe means four alive ones. It means enough to transplant with a side order of dead tissue that we can test.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It makes sense. Unlike you stealing my phone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have unlimited texting. Until your parents know, you will never see that punch for what it really was. Your February 4th. Sri Lankan Independence Day.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I told you I'm Korean and Filipino.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And I told you I wasn't listening. By my actions.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Violence isn't an appropriate way to handle conflict. It was a moment of weakness.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You barked at me, picked a fight with a painting crew. Maybe it's time to recognize it's not a character flaw. Maybe it's your character.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pinto!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Embrace your inner bitch.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So why did chelation make the lungs worse?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We got about five minutes till Pinto gets back. Give me a hand with this.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I tracked down another bag of plasma from the batch they used on the donor. Negative for all our other exposures.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sarcoidosis could be inflamed by the treatment. I am a cripple, in need of assistance.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Um, transplant team ran an A.C.E. Negative.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's mine. And it's your job.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: My job is to assist you in curing the lungs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This chair will help me do that.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: What if the scrapings from the bridge contained other heavy metals like barilium or asbestos?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chelation for lead wouldn't have made them worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But… maybe the problem isn't a heavy metal from outside. It's inside. But it's not leaving the body like it's supposed to. It's stuck. Iron. The donor had hemosiderosis.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: His body wasn't disposing of iron. Massive amounts choke up the lungs. Then our chelation would wreak havoc because it picks up too much stuff.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Go stain the dead lung tissue for iron.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm sorry, young lady, I simply will not help you steal this chair.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pinto.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: She can barely catch her breath.

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: Lungs ready yet?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We're testing for iron overload.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: I thought it was lead.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: This is not an exact process. Your small airways are collapsing. You're not getting enough oxygen. I'd like to try forcing an oxygen-rich slurry into your lungs. It should open up the airways and buy you some time until the lungs are ready.

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: Fluid? In my lungs? Sounds like drow…drowning.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It is.

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: Gonna hurt, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, a fair amount.

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: No. I'm done.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, the nurses saw you come in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Enter.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's a bathroom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ah, explains the hole in this chair.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: God, I missed doors. And air freshener.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now go away. I'm waiting for some test results.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: My patient signed a DNR. She's giving up. Looks like someone else will be getting the lungs. Making this yet another interaction with you in which I get nothing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not my fault you can't handle your patient.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She said she's done. I spent half an hour trying to change her mind, but she'd made her decision. I accepted that. It's called respect.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And what's after respect? You find another angle. You hold her hand, get the sister to beg, stick your fingers in your ears, pretend you can't hear. You do whatever it takes.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, whatever it takes. Thanks, House. I hadn't thought of that.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What are you testing for?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Hemosiderosis. I'm staining for excess iron.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Promising. When your dad showed up unexpectedly, House have a hand in that?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm guessing he does things like that a lot.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His version of a compliment. I spoke to the head of neurology in Chicago. I gave you a good recommendation.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Did you mention what happened?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Lawyers say I'm not allowed to. It works out well for everyone.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Why exactly is that good for you?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm a talented physician, top 2% of my class. I'm an asset to this hospital, an asset you're about to lose to Chicago.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You applied for the job. You asked me to call and recommend you.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Andrews is the one that should leave. He's the supervisor. He touched me first.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I can't discuss any of that, not before the hearing. But if you're having doubts about Chicago, I can call them back.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: No. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Dr. Foreman? Would you look at this?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Iron?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: No. White blood cells.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Classic presentation of infection.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: How the hell did we miss that?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Biopsy revealed, white blood cell inflitrates.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Infection was right, after all.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fresh fruit in prison is usually chicken.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Why aren't you more alarmed? We're running out of time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Aahh, she's dying! Were you able to figure out what was wrong while I was screaming?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Infection was the first thing that the transplant team treated for.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which would have worked if the bacteria had been out in the open. If they're hiding inside the lung cells… I'm thinking brucella. And to wipe that out, you need special ops. An intact immune system.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: But that's what white blood cells are.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They're part of the immune defense force, like the infantry. But those lungs need the Air Force and the Marines, antibodies raining down from above.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Antibiotics and IVIG.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Did you use metaphors for your old team? Or do you just think I'm particularly stupid?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, they were stupid too.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: I'm here for Vanessa.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: Now is not the time, Bobby.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: She asked me to come. Right, Doc?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Actually, it was my idea.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: What? What were you thinking? She doesn't want to see him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: When Vanessa was ready to quit chemo, Bobby's the one who got her to do one more round.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: Yeah, and then he got her drunk. At least tell me you haven't been drinking today.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: I should go.

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: Hail, hail, the gang's all here.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Hey beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Vanessa
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Case is under control. It's me time.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Vanessa's gonna do the lung slurry. You were right to push me. I needed that. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So we're good?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It was good advice. Just, came here to say thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I like you. I have fun with you. And, if you can honestly say that you don't like me, you don't have fun with me, I can accept that. But, just do whatever you have to do to get over this. You can punch me in the face, kick me in the nuts. Either/or. Both seems excessive.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The thing is, House… I don't like you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When did the discoloration start?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: A few minutes after I started the IVIG.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Means we're wrong about infection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wrong about autoimmune, not cancer, heavy metals, genetic issues… Increase peep.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need… I need ideas.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: IgA nephropathy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's already ruled out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No--o.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Maybe we're just out of time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're out of time when we're out of time. When they die or she dies. Keep them stable as long as you can. I need to think.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: One, two… three…

utterance.speaker: Everyone
utterance.content: Make a wish. Make a wish.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The lungs are a smoker. You of all people should know better.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: But the kid never smoked.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He played poker. Who plays poker without cigars? Even if he didn't light up himself… It was a rainy night. The windows were closed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All parents think their kids are special. And these ones were right. At least his white blood cells were special. They had an on switch for reacting to smoke, but no off. When he inhaled small amounts of smoke, he had small problems. No one even noticed. Big amounts of smoke, that's enough to trash a lung. As soon as he breathed in all that cigar smoke, he was a dead man. The motorcycle accident was an unnecessary dramatic flourish.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Eosiniphilic pneumonitis. But, the steroids would have treated for that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was right. Not about anything medical, but my metaphors were perfect. We need to hit it harder. We need to carpet bomb, blitzkrieg. We need the nuclear option.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: At some point you're going to say we need to radiate, right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See, the metaphors work.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: But that'll destroy the good lung too. Better to go with a strong cocktail of immunosuppressants.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Won't be fast enough. Wilson needs these lungs.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It's working.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He did it.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm not going to Chicago.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you stay, we have to have a hearing.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Dad… Do you have a minute?

utterance.speaker: Surgeon
utterance.content: Thoracic cavity clear. Ready for the donor lungs.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: Thank God you called him.

utterance.speaker: Theresa
utterance.content: I wonder what happens now.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She can handle it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Got something for you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I found your stuff in storage.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: This is all you get. Ortho still has the outer office.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, that sucks. Where are Chase, Taub, and Thirteen gonna sit?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're welcome, House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oof!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ah!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Dinner later? I’ll pick something up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I heard about a good new vegetarian place.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Screw that. I want a steak.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'll meet you at your place at 8:00.
